Posts.Content: From time to time I get a sharp pain roughly where the op was.  It only lasts seconds and I am told it is probably scar tissue stretching.  Does anyone else experience this?
Posts.Title: Boob pains

Posts.Content: Thank you  At least I know now it is not unusual.  I have an appointment at the hospital in a few weeks so I'll wait until then and discuss it with them.  It doesn't feel sinister.
Posts.Title: Boob pains

Posts.Content: Thank you.  Nobody said this was normal so I wasn't sure.  It almost feels as if the sides of the incision are clicking together but I'm told this can't happen!!!! I  finished radiotherapy last April but this has worsened with spring cleaning so perhaps I pulled the scar or a muscle!  While I wouldn't wish the pains on anyone its good to know I'm not unusual
Posts.Title: Boob pains

Posts.Content: Thank you everyone.  At least I know it's not unusual now.
Posts.Title: Boob pains

Posts.Content: Hi!  Try massaging in bio-oil.  It's quite expensive but a little goes a long way.  I found it very helpful and the lymph node scar now hardly shows.  Good luck!
Posts.Title: Time taken for breast to feel less itchy and hot after radiotherapy...

Posts.Content: Anastrozole made me sick - big time!  The first week I couldn't keep any food down, just drank Lucozade which sent my sugar levels sky high!  You can't win!  My oncologist changed the drug to Exemestane and I have had no problems with that.  Don't be afraid to ask for a different medication.  You have to put up with enough without un-necessary side effects.
Posts.Title: Anastrozole and dizziness
